intro: Listrostachys wittmackii, commonly known as the Wittmack's listrostachys, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
